lead_paragraph: President Ashraf Ghani dropped his conciliatory approach and threatened to go to the United Nations if Pakistan failed to strike the Taliban on its soil.

headline.print_headline: Afghan Leader Demands Pakistan Take On Taliban
headline.main: Afghan President Demands Pakistan Take Military Action Against Taliban

snippet: President Ashraf Ghani dropped his conciliatory approach and threatened to go to the United Nations if Pakistan failed to strike the Taliban on its soil.
abstract: Afghan Pres Ashraf Ghani, abandoning diplomatic courtship, calls forcefully upon Pakistan to take military action against Taliban officers operating within its borders and threatens to lodge complaint with United Nations if Pakistan does not comply; shift in tone follows resurgence of violence.
